page.title: 08MADELEY STAFFS : RECREATION
page.content: Madeley is fortunate in having a large Village Hall which is much in use for public & private functions,including playschool,holiday play scheme,keep fit badminton,Darby & Joan club,flower club Women's Institute,whist drives,bingo & discos;all held on a regular basis.The Newcastle Recreation Project opened a centre in January 1985 in part of the former Madeley College campus.Funded by the Manpower Services Commission,it offers a range of physical activities to housebound mums,people unempoyed or retired.Climbing,squash,netball,jogging badminton,swimming & aerobics:all go on Activities organised in local pubs & clubs include dominoes,pigeon flying, darts,pool & fishing.Many simply relax over a pint. A small local fun fair usually sets up on land adjoining the Village Hall, twice yearly.All one needs is time.
